Name: Bloody Negroni
Instructions: Select and pre-chill an Old-fashioned glass .
Prepare garnish of blood orange slice wheel.
Briefly STIR all ingredients with ice.
Review: A classic Negroni consists of equal parts gin, Italian red bitters and sweet vermouth garnished with an orange slice. When in season, a splash of blood orange juice adds a refreshing citrusy tang.
History: Made by yours truly in February 2014 at the Cabinet Room, London, England. (Although I'm sure someone came up with this combo years before.) Negroni cocktail history and recipe variations
Nutrition: One serving of Bloody Negroni contains 149 calories
